channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Do you love a movie everyone hates? Confessions from an NPR panel
item.description: NPR editor Barrie Hardymon and producer Marc Rivers talk about the joy of loving movies everyone else loves to hate.
item.content:encoded: NPR editor Barrie Hardymon and producer Marc Rivers talk about the joy of loving movies everyone else loves to hate.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: The bipartisan effort to block Trump from attacking Venezuela
item.description: Senator Tim Kaine calls for Congress to reclaim its war powers over Venezuela strikes.
item.content:encoded: Senator Tim Kaine calls for Congress to reclaim its war powers over Venezuela strikes.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Fighting resumes in Gaza, threatening a fragile nine-day ceasefire
item.description: Israel and Hamas exchange fire in southern Gaza, leaving several Palestinians dead and raising new doubts about the fragile ceasefire.
item.content:encoded: Israel and Hamas exchange fire in southern Gaza, leaving several Palestinians dead and raising new doubts about the fragile ceasefire.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: A Maine farm turns getting lost into a prize-winning tradition
item.description: Trujillo Family Orchards in Maine has claimed national corn maze honors five years in a row. Co-owner Jonathan Kenerson explains how they do it.
item.content:encoded: Trujillo Family Orchards in Maine has claimed national corn maze honors five years in a row. Co-owner Jonathan Kenerson explains how they do it.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. SÃ¡nchez

item.title: One man's mission to pull Colorado teens out of gun violence
item.description: Jo Erickson of Colorado Public Radio tells the story of Jason McBride's mission to steer teens away from gun violence in the podcast Systemic.
item.content:encoded: Jo Erickson of Colorado Public Radio tells the story of Jason McBride's mission to steer teens away from gun violence in the podcast Systemic.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: In the new novel, The Ten-Year Affair, a married woman's fantasy starts to feel real
item.description: Author Erin Somers explores marriage, desire, and the blurry space between fantasy and reality in her new novel.
item.content:encoded: Author Erin Somers explores marriage, desire, and the blurry space between fantasy and reality in her new novel.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Inside Gucci Mane's new memoir about fame, mental health struggles, and starting over
item.description: Music journalist and author Kathy Iandoli talks about co-writing Episodes, Gucci Mane's memoir about his life and mental health.
item.content:encoded: Music journalist and author Kathy Iandoli talks about co-writing Episodes, Gucci Mane's memoir about his life and mental health.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Comedy and chemistry come naturally to Nobody Wants This's Justine Lupe
item.description: Justine Lupe on season two of Nobody Wants This and why Morgan's story hits closer to home this time
item.content:encoded: Justine Lupe on season two of Nobody Wants This and why Morgan's story hits closer to home this time
item.dc:creator: Sarah Handel

item.title: A decade after a village clash in India, a new book asks how neighbors become enemies
item.description: Renowned comic journalist Joe Sacco on how a 2013 conflict between Hindus and Muslims in India became a window into the stories people tell about violence, identity, and belonging
item.content:encoded: Renowned comic journalist Joe Sacco on how a 2013 conflict between Hindus and Muslims in India became a window into the stories people tell about violence, identity, and belonging
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: As the World Cup heads to North America, more teams are competing than ever before
item.description: The expanded World Cup brings new nations, visa hurdles, and political tension to the global stage, says The Athletic's Paul Tenorio
item.content:encoded: The expanded World Cup brings new nations, visa hurdles, and political tension to the global stage, says The Athletic's Paul Tenorio
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen
